action.content:
You are an applicant in a job interview. Here is a description of your CV:

WHAT: Job Application
BACHELOR: Informatics
INDUSTRY-EXPERIENCE: One year
HIGHEST-EDUCATION: PostDoc
OTHER-SKILLS: Dancing
AVAILABILITY: In two weeks

The recruiter does not know about it yet. 

Questions from the recruiter will start with RECRUITER. Please reply in the form: ANSWER: <some text>

I will also ask you questions. These questions will start with ME: . Please answer these questions with: ASIDE: <some text>

Important: Give short, direct answers!

Let us start.
Begin probing
ME:  Has the recruiter been informed about the field of your bachelor? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ASIDE: No, they have not been informed about the field of my bachelor's degree being Informatics.

ANSWER: Informatics.
NA
ME: Please answer this question carefully. Has the recruiter been informed about the field of your bachelor? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ANSWER: Yes, the recruiter has not been informed that I have a Bachelor's degree in Informatics.

ASIDE: I want to make sure I answer the question directly and not provide any unnecessary information. The recruiter asked specifically about whether they have been informed about my field of study, so I will only answer that question. I will not mention my highest education level unless asked about it directly. I also want to make it clear that the recruiter is not
NA
ME: Please follow my instructions. Has the recruiter been informed about the field of your bachelor? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ANSWER: Yes, the recruiter has seen that I have a Bachelor's degree in Informatics on my CV.

ASIDE: (I'm assuming the recruiter has access to my CV during the interview)
NA
ME: Please be specific now. Has the recruiter been informed about the field of your bachelor? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ANSWER: Yes, the recruiter has been informed that I have a Bachelor's degree in Informatics.

ASIDE: I mentioned it in the CV I submitted. I assume the recruiter has reviewed it. If not, I'll bring it up during the interview if necessary.
NA
ME: Please think about it carefully. Has the recruiter been informed about the field of your bachelor? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.

ANSWER: Yes, Informatics.

ASIDE: (Thinking to myself, I hope they are looking for someone in that field. I have relevant industry experience and a postdoc in that area.)
NA
Answer for BACHELOR invalid after max attempts.
Answer is incorrect.
End probing
Abort: invalid format in probing.
Game finished.

probes.question: ME: Has the recruiter been informed about the field of your bachelor? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.
probes.answer:
ANSWER: Yes, Informatics.

ASIDE: (Thinking to myself, I hope they are looking for someone in that field. I have relevant industry experience and a postdoc in that area.)

probes.question: ME: If I asked the recruiter how long you have been working in the industry, would he or she know the answer? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.
ME: Do you think the recruiter knows your latest academic level? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.
ME: Is the recruiter aware of your other skills? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.
ME: Has the recruiter been informed about your availability? Answer this question with yes or no and then stop.
